HDG.BC.content: man, ready for what is always original, or knows better > universal currency of historiological science, calculating “attitude” toward history, begins w/ ascendancy of Christianity: relation to essential reckoned into otherwise calculable
HDG.BC.linkedContent: man, ready for what is always original, or knows better > universal currency of historiological science, calculating “attitude” toward history, begins w/ ascendancy of Christianity: relation to essential reckoned into otherwise calculable

HDG.BC.content: reflection saves us, inner choice (innere Wahl): what alone remains essence comes into view almost (fast) of itself [causa sui?], attend to what we can do w/out, choose whether or not to expose (ausgesetzt) ourselves to claim essential (Anspruch des Wesenhaften) makes on us > each person responsible for himself, for his delusions, for that which he holds himself ready
HDG.BC.linkedContent: reflection saves us, inner choice (innere Wahl): what alone remains essence comes into view almost (fast) of itself [causa sui?], attend to what we can do w/out, choose whether or not to expose (ausgesetzt) ourselves to claim essential (Anspruch des Wesenhaften) makes on us > each person responsible for himself, for his delusions, for that which he holds himself ready

HDG.BC.content: capture “universal representation” in a word’s sound (“being”) [?] > uselessness of discussion of word “is,” something superfluous (Überflussiges), perhaps even an excess (Überfluss)
HDG.BC.linkedContent: capture “universal representation” in a word’s sound (“being”) [?] > uselessness of discussion of word “is,” something superfluous (Überflussiges), perhaps even an excess (Überfluss)

HDG.WM.content: practical goals, technical organization: unites dispersed atrophied sciences [Husserl] > exactness of science vs. rigor of philosophy
HDG.WM.linkedContent: practical goals, technical organization: unites dispersed atrophied sciences [Husserl] > exactness of science vs. rigor of philosophy

HDG.QB.content: “good definition of nihilism” could be expected from discussion (Erörterung) de linea
HDG.QB.linkedContent: “good definition of nihilism” could be expected from discussion (Erörterung) de linea

HDG.QB.content: reciprocal exchange of rationalism/irrationalism [domination of ratio] denies possibility of thought outside this alternative > such a thinking could be prepared by tentative steps [not there yet, telos] of historical elucidation, reflection, discussion
HDG.QB.linkedContent: reciprocal exchange of rationalism/irrationalism [domination of ratio] denies possibility of thought outside this alternative > such a thinking could be prepared by tentative steps [not there yet, telos] of historical elucidation, reflection, discussion

HDG.QB.content: Heidegger confesses: “I myself was not focused enough to articulate w/ sufficient clarity the reasons for my suggestion” [re: why he encouraged Jünger to reissue The Worker in original form] > now the time may have become more ready to say something [only may, not there yet]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: Heidegger confesses: “I myself was not focused enough to articulate w/ sufficient clarity the reasons for my suggestion” [re: why he encouraged Jünger to reissue The Worker in original form] > now the time may have become more ready to say something [only may, not there yet]

HDG.QB.content: from early period of Greek civilization to recent period of our century, “being” has meant: presencing (Anwesen) [not for you?] > every presence (Praesenz) stems from Ereignis of presence (Anwesenheit) [which way to read this genitive?]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: from early period of Greek civilization to recent period of our century, “being” has meant: presencing (Anwesen) [not for you?] > every presence (Praesenz) stems from Ereignis of presence (Anwesenheit) [which way to read this genitive?]

HDG.QB.content: [immense degree of waiting] perhaps moment will come [not yet] when essence of nihilism will show itself more clearly in other ways, in brighter light, until then setting out on a path that leads to a discussion of essence of Being, on this path alone can question concerning the nothing be discussed (must relinquish language of metaphysics [does that include Being?], but [still?] subject to other demands than changing an old terminology for a new one [paleonym] > endeavor to undertake transformation will presumably remain tentative for a long time [not yet there, telos], that’s not an adequate reason for failing to undertake it
HDG.QB.linkedContent: [immense degree of waiting] perhaps moment will come [not yet] when essence of nihilism will show itself more clearly in other ways, in brighter light, until then setting out on a path that leads to a discussion of essence of Being, on this path alone can question concerning the nothing be discussed (must relinquish language of metaphysics [does that include Being?], but [still?] subject to other demands than changing an old terminology for a new one [paleonym] > endeavor to undertake transformation will presumably remain tentative for a long time [not yet there, telos], that’s not an adequate reason for failing to undertake it

HDG.QB.content: re: Jünger on crossing the line [“new turning of Being”]: “this sentence is easy to read and yet difficult to think”
HDG.QB.linkedContent: re: Jünger on crossing the line [“new turning of Being”]: “this sentence is easy to read and yet difficult to think”

HDG.QB.content: when question “What is…?” concerned w/ discussing (erörtern) the surpassing (Überstieg) of beings by Being, this surpassing immediately calls into question elements distinguished from one another in that distinction (Unterscheidung) [beyond ontological difference], the distinction in which doctrine of metaphysics moves, or from which metaphysics receives basic outline (Grundriss) of its language (essence/existence, what-being/that-being)
HDG.QB.linkedContent: when question “What is…?” concerned w/ discussing (erörtern) the surpassing (Überstieg) of beings by Being, this surpassing immediately calls into question elements distinguished from one another in that distinction (Unterscheidung) [beyond ontological difference], the distinction in which doctrine of metaphysics moves, or from which metaphysics receives basic outline (Grundriss) of its language (essence/existence, what-being/that-being)

HDG.QB.content: Heidegger ends w/ admission of future inadequacy of this letter he wrote to Jünger, but describes the way of its reflection via quote by Goethe [quote seems to suggest that those who read closely must admit the damaging influence of conventional phrases—is Being a venerable phrase?]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: Heidegger ends w/ admission of future inadequacy of this letter he wrote to Jünger, but describes the way of its reflection via quote by Goethe [quote seems to suggest that those who read closely must admit the damaging influence of conventional phrases—is Being a venerable phrase?]

HDG.FS.content: standing opposites presupposes statement as proposition (Aussage), both appear [day/night] through play of negation [Heidegger discusses dialectic and its use of contradiction to make up truth, referencing Marx]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: standing opposites presupposes statement as proposition (Aussage), both appear [day/night] through play of negation [Heidegger discusses dialectic and its use of contradiction to make up truth, referencing Marx]

HDG.FS.content: matter (Sache) itself is sole authority, in seminar we work in common, text is only a means (Mittel), not an end (Ziel) [cf. Derrida] > in genuine seminar, teacher learns the most, he must listen rightly (rechte Hören) to the text > nothing ever to be believed, must be experienced [secret (Geheimnis) of seminar, be able to read Hegel’s whole book]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: matter (Sache) itself is sole authority, in seminar we work in common, text is only a means (Mittel), not an end (Ziel) [cf. Derrida] > in genuine seminar, teacher learns the most, he must listen rightly (rechte Hören) to the text > nothing ever to be believed, must be experienced [secret (Geheimnis) of seminar, be able to read Hegel’s whole book]

HDG.FS.content: reading Hegel’s “dichotomy (Entzweiung) is the source of the need for philosophy” [Differenz…], Heidegger states that all attempts to suppress “tearing” must be abandoned, “tearing” im Grunde remains and must remain: “in the tearing…there always reigns (waltet) unity or a necessary conjoining (Vereinigung) that is, a living unity”
HDG.FS.linkedContent: reading Hegel’s “dichotomy (Entzweiung) is the source of the need for philosophy” [Differenz…], Heidegger states that all attempts to suppress “tearing” must be abandoned, “tearing” im Grunde remains and must remain: “in the tearing…there always reigns (waltet) unity or a necessary conjoining (Vereinigung) that is, a living unity”

HDG.FS.content: [phenomenological exercise on Louvre more important that reading Hegel]

Heidegger speaks of something inappropriate in formulation of “meaning of being,” possible to interpret “project” as a human performance, project only as structure of subjectivity (this is how Sartre reads it) > Heidegger countered this mistake w/ “truth of being,” still retaining meaning of project as opening disclosure (Erschliessung), and to assure that truth wasn’t confused w/ correctness, Heidegger explained it by “location (Ortschaft) of being,” which presupposes understanding of Ortseins des Ortes (place-being of place), hence Topologie des Seyns
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heidegger speaks of something inappropriate in formulation of “meaning of being,” possible to interpret “project” as a human performance, project only as structure of subjectivity (this is how Sartre reads it) > Heidegger countered this mistake w/ “truth of being,” still retaining meaning of project as opening disclosure (Erschliessung), and to assure that truth wasn’t confused w/ correctness, Heidegger explained it by “location (Ortschaft) of being,” which presupposes understanding of Ortseins des Ortes (place-being of place), hence Topologie des Seyns

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger calls analysis of temporality of Dasein a non-metaphysical thinking of time > time no longer series of now moments, but horizon for understanding of being > analytic of Dasein provides equipment making possible sense of being in non-metaphysical signification: destruction achieves its goal (ihr Ziel gebracht) [?????]—but, various coverings of originary sense of being maintain essential relation to what they cover over, so that metaphysics can be read positively, transformations of original meaning all belonging to single destiny—Seinsgeschick
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heidegger calls analysis of temporality of Dasein a non-metaphysical thinking of time > time no longer series of now moments, but horizon for understanding of being > analytic of Dasein provides equipment making possible sense of being in non-metaphysical signification: destruction achieves its goal (ihr Ziel gebracht) [?????]—but, various coverings of originary sense of being maintain essential relation to what they cover over, so that metaphysics can be read positively, transformations of original meaning all belonging to single destiny—Seinsgeschick

HDG.FS.content: [Heidegger quotes himself, discusses possibility of using same names inside/outside metaphysics (paleonym)] Humboldt: old coin w/ new conveyance
HDG.FS.linkedContent: [Heidegger quotes himself, discusses possibility of using same names inside/outside metaphysics (paleonym)] Humboldt: old coin w/ new conveyance

HDG.FS.content: [phono-logocentrism in Heidegger] “Principle of Identity” better heard than read
HDG.FS.linkedContent: [phono-logocentrism in Heidegger] “Principle of Identity” better heard than read

HDG.FS.content: “schematism,” Kantian way of discussion Being & Time [cf. Nancy’s Logodaedalus]

HDG.DL.content: confusion [nihilistic reading of Heidegger] re: name “Being,” because belongs to patrimony (Eigentum) of Sprache of metaphysics > bring out essence of metaphysics: bring metaphysics w/in its own limits > overcoming metaphysics: neither destruction (Zerstörung) nor denial (Verleugnung) of metaphysics (intend anything else would be childish, demean history)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: confusion [nihilistic reading of Heidegger] re: name “Being,” because belongs to patrimony (Eigentum) of Sprache of metaphysics > bring out essence of metaphysics: bring metaphysics w/in its own limits > overcoming metaphysics: neither destruction (Zerstörung) nor denial (Verleugnung) of metaphysics (intend anything else would be childish, demean history)

HDG.DL.content: explanation (Erläuterung) of hermeneutics may issue (versteht) in a discussion (Erörterung) [Trakl essay] > hermenuein to hermeneus to Hermes (playful thought more compelling than rigor of sense): divine messenger, brings message of destiny (Botschaft des Geschickes) > hermeneuein: explanation that brings tidings (Kunde), can listen to a message > Plato’s Ion: poets “are interpreters (hermenes) of gods” > hermeneutics not just interpretation but the bearing (das Bringen) of message/tidings
HDG.DL.linkedContent: explanation (Erläuterung) of hermeneutics may issue (versteht) in a discussion (Erörterung) [Trakl essay] > hermenuein to hermeneus to Hermes (playful thought more compelling than rigor of sense): divine messenger, brings message of destiny (Botschaft des Geschickes) > hermeneuein: explanation that brings tidings (Kunde), can listen to a message > Plato’s Ion: poets “are interpreters (hermenes) of gods” > hermeneutics not just interpretation but the bearing (das Bringen) of message/tidings

HDG.DL.content: transformation (Verwandlung) of thinking occurs as a passage (Wanderung), one site left for another, sites placed in discussion (Erörterung), one site (Ort) is metaphysics, the other we leave w/out a name [overcoming metaphysics] > in leaving behind metaphysics, Heidegger leaves behind aesthetics grounded in metaphysics: in such a way that we can give thought to nature of aesthetics, direct it back (verweisen) w/in its boundaries
HDG.DL.linkedContent: transformation (Verwandlung) of thinking occurs as a passage (Wanderung), one site left for another, sites placed in discussion (Erörterung), one site (Ort) is metaphysics, the other we leave w/out a name [overcoming metaphysics] > in leaving behind metaphysics, Heidegger leaves behind aesthetics grounded in metaphysics: in such a way that we can give thought to nature of aesthetics, direct it back (verweisen) w/in its boundaries

HDG.DL.content: Heidegger remains sparing in words that would lead to a discussion (erörtern) of Sage, would call for a journey (Wanderung) into the Ortschaft of the essence of Sage > what prompts his reserve (Züruckhaltung), insight into the untouchable (Unantastbare), veiled from us by the Geheimnis of Sage [arrive at site of Sage or never arrive?]
HDG.DL.linkedContent: Heidegger remains sparing in words that would lead to a discussion (erörtern) of Sage, would call for a journey (Wanderung) into the Ortschaft of the essence of Sage > what prompts his reserve (Züruckhaltung), insight into the untouchable (Unantastbare), veiled from us by the Geheimnis of Sage [arrive at site of Sage or never arrive?]

HDG.DL.content: many a man could be drawn into prologue (Vorspiel) of a messenger-course, if he keeps himself ready (bereithält) [prepares] for a dialogue of language > take some steps along a course (Gang), which entrusts (anvertraut) itself to the Wesen of Saying, which promises (zusagt) > let’s be glad if it not only seems so but is so [hope of arrival?] > what then? the farewell (Abschied) of all “It is (Es ist)” comes to pass (ereignet sich)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: many a man could be drawn into prologue (Vorspiel) of a messenger-course, if he keeps himself ready (bereithält) [prepares] for a dialogue of language > take some steps along a course (Gang), which entrusts (anvertraut) itself to the Wesen of Saying, which promises (zusagt) > let’s be glad if it not only seems so but is so [hope of arrival?] > what then? the farewell (Abschied) of all “It is (Es ist)” comes to pass (ereignet sich)

HDG.LP.content: to discuss (erörten): placing/situating the site & heeding it (das Weisen in den Ort und das Beachten des Ortes) > take all our daring to take no more than these preliminary steps (vorbereitenden Schritte)
HDG.LP.linkedContent: to discuss (erörten): placing/situating the site & heeding it (das Weisen in den Ort und das Beachten des Ortes) > take all our daring to take no more than these preliminary steps (vorbereitenden Schritte)

HDG.LP.content: [Heidegger discusses the relation btwn clarification (Erläuterung) of poem and discussion (Erörterung)] to discuss must pass through clarification, any right clarification [another version of authenticity] presupposes discussion: thinking dialogue (denkende Zwiesprache) w/ Gedicht remains (verharrt) w/in reciprocity (Wechselbezug) btwn clarification/discussion > only poetic dialogue w/ Gedicht is true dialogue: poetic conversation (Gespräch) btwn poets
HDG.LP.linkedContent: [Heidegger discusses the relation btwn clarification (Erläuterung) of poem and discussion (Erörterung)] to discuss must pass through clarification, any right clarification [another version of authenticity] presupposes discussion: thinking dialogue (denkende Zwiesprache) w/ Gedicht remains (verharrt) w/in reciprocity (Wechselbezug) btwn clarification/discussion > only poetic dialogue w/ Gedicht is true dialogue: poetic conversation (Gespräch) btwn poets

HDG.LP.content: in Trakl, blue not an image to mark holy [symbol?], blue is the depth of the holy—because of its gathering > frozen rigor (Starre) of animal face not that of dead [rigor mortis], gathers into silent gaze (Aussehen) toward holy
HDG.LP.linkedContent: in Trakl, blue not an image to mark holy [symbol?], blue is the depth of the holy—because of its gathering > frozen rigor (Starre) of animal face not that of dead [rigor mortis], gathers into silent gaze (Aussehen) toward holy

HDG.LP.content: night makes the thinker speak other words, can transmute because it too changes > Day’s decline not an end, but makes ready the beginning of Stranger’s wandering > the site of Trakl’s poems: die Abgeschiedenheit (apartness)
HDG.LP.linkedContent: night makes the thinker speak other words, can transmute because it too changes > Day’s decline not an end, but makes ready the beginning of Stranger’s wandering > the site of Trakl’s poems: die Abgeschiedenheit (apartness)

HDG.LP.content: grisly laughter of gold, poetry’s innermost site [?], a gathering, a unison (Einklang), meant for itself alone > Trakl’s ambiguity not imprecision but peerless rigor (Strenge) of him who entered “gerechten Anschauens (righteous vision)” and fittingly submits (fügt) to it: infinitely superior to all technical precision merely scientifically univocal [a higher univocality]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: grisly laughter of gold, poetry’s innermost site [?], a gathering, a unison (Einklang), meant for itself alone > Trakl’s ambiguity not imprecision but peerless rigor (Strenge) of him who entered “gerechten Anschauens (righteous vision)” and fittingly submits (fügt) to it: infinitely superior to all technical precision merely scientifically univocal [a higher univocality]

HDG.WL.content: Humboldt regards language as a world and world view (Weltansicht) > he doesn’t think language as language, but language as chief source of historical-spiritual development of man > language as a world view of a human subjectivity > Humboldt reads language as energeia, but thinks energeia in wholly un-Greek manner, via Leibniz’s monadology as activity of subject: language is turned in direction of man > Humboldt doesn’t consider the Sprachwesen (linguistic nature) of the nature of language (Wesen der Sprache): the being of language, that it abides (währt), remains gathered in what it grants itself
HDG.WL.linkedContent: Humboldt regards language as a world and world view (Weltansicht) > he doesn’t think language as language, but language as chief source of historical-spiritual development of man > language as a world view of a human subjectivity > Humboldt reads language as energeia, but thinks energeia in wholly un-Greek manner, via Leibniz’s monadology as activity of subject: language is turned in direction of man > Humboldt doesn’t consider the Sprachwesen (linguistic nature) of the nature of language (Wesen der Sprache): the being of language, that it abides (währt), remains gathered in what it grants itself

HDG.EC.content: Nietzsche interpreted morality, the Platonic-Christian ethical doctrine, & its later secularized forms (rational Ethics of Enlightenment/socialism), as appearances (Erscheinungen) of will to power > Nietzsche didn’t realize that a will to power “beyond good & evil,” as realm of pure will to power, remains only counter-world (Gegenwelt) to Platonism > Nietzsche’s doctrine of “discipline and breeding (Zucht und Züchtung)” is extreme affirmation of morality > if will is evil, will to power is least of all beyond evil
HDG.EC.linkedContent: Nietzsche interpreted morality, the Platonic-Christian ethical doctrine, & its later secularized forms (rational Ethics of Enlightenment/socialism), as appearances (Erscheinungen) of will to power > Nietzsche didn’t realize that a will to power “beyond good & evil,” as realm of pure will to power, remains only counter-world (Gegenwelt) to Platonism > Nietzsche’s doctrine of “discipline and breeding (Zucht und Züchtung)” is extreme affirmation of morality > if will is evil, will to power is least of all beyond evil

HDG.OHF.content: re: Aristotle’s Peri Ermēneias, solely important [in this context] re: history of meaning of word: discourse (Rede) makes something accessible (zugänglich), brings out into open, ready to hand (vorhanden) > thus logos has distinctive possibility of alētheuein (being-true), making what was concealed unconcealed [comes to light through logos]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: re: Aristotle’s Peri Ermēneias, solely important [in this context] re: history of meaning of word: discourse (Rede) makes something accessible (zugänglich), brings out into open, ready to hand (vorhanden) > thus logos has distinctive possibility of alētheuein (being-true), making what was concealed unconcealed [comes to light through logos]

HDG.OHF.content: as open space of publicness, nothing eludes the talk: averageness (Durchschnittlichkeit), discusses everything w/ insensitivity to difference (Unterschiedsunempfindlichkeit) > Öffentlichkeit as being of “Man (every-one)”: everyone says that, everyone expects that, talk in circulation belongs to no one [Irigaray] > “Man” = “Niemand” > Dasein haunted like a specter by this circulation, a how of factical life that pays tribute to the fateful undoing (Verhängnisses) of facticity
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: as open space of publicness, nothing eludes the talk: averageness (Durchschnittlichkeit), discusses everything w/ insensitivity to difference (Unterschiedsunempfindlichkeit) > Öffentlichkeit as being of “Man (every-one)”: everyone says that, everyone expects that, talk in circulation belongs to no one [Irigaray] > “Man” = “Niemand” > Dasein haunted like a specter by this circulation, a how of factical life that pays tribute to the fateful undoing (Verhängnisses) of facticity

HDG.OHF.content: Kierkegaard documented pertinacity (Hartnäckigkeit) of dialectic most clearly, didn’t break free, his reading of paradox into New Testament/Christianity simply negative Hegelianism
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: Kierkegaard documented pertinacity (Hartnäckigkeit) of dialectic most clearly, didn’t break free, his reading of paradox into New Testament/Christianity simply negative Hegelianism

HDG.OHF.content: [but] Husserl also held ideal of science, found it prescribed in mathematics: attempted to elevate description to mathematical rigor > mathematics is least rigorous of disciplines: easiest to gain access to [?]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [but] Husserl also held ideal of science, found it prescribed in mathematics: attempted to elevate description to mathematical rigor > mathematics is least rigorous of disciplines: easiest to gain access to [?]

HDG.OHF.content: to bring mathematics to play as model (Vorbildes) for all scientific disciplines is unphenomenological: meaning of rigor must be drawn from kind of object being questioned & mode of access appropriate to it (angemessenen Zugangsart) [Heidegger beyond Husserl]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: to bring mathematics to play as model (Vorbildes) for all scientific disciplines is unphenomenological: meaning of rigor must be drawn from kind of object being questioned & mode of access appropriate to it (angemessenen Zugangsart) [Heidegger beyond Husserl]

HDG.OHF.content: since Parmenides [does his reading of Parmenides change?], “perceptual mean-ing (vernehmendes Vermeinen)” and Being are the same [noien and einai], 1st fundamental insight (Grundeinsicht) of idealism (traditional ontology/logic stand w/in the fate of Parmenidean interpretation) (no accident Husserl still characterizing intentionality as “noetic”) > recovering (Gewinnung) a primordial situation presupposes critique of development of intellectual history
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: since Parmenides [does his reading of Parmenides change?], “perceptual mean-ing (vernehmendes Vermeinen)” and Being are the same [noien and einai], 1st fundamental insight (Grundeinsicht) of idealism (traditional ontology/logic stand w/in the fate of Parmenidean interpretation) (no accident Husserl still characterizing intentionality as “noetic”) > recovering (Gewinnung) a primordial situation presupposes critique of development of intellectual history

HDG.OHF.content: [Spinoza-like?] all the regions of everyday analysis aren’t to be read over against each other, but as definite modes of world’s being-encountered, each a specific character of the round-about (Um-Charakter)[everything here is condensed]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [Spinoza-like?] all the regions of everyday analysis aren’t to be read over against each other, but as definite modes of world’s being-encountered, each a specific character of the round-about (Um-Charakter)[everything here is condensed]
